intro_text: Your patrol catches the scent of a grizzly bear. Tracking it, they find the animal feeding on a pronghorn fawn carcass.
decline_text: Your patrol decides not to quarrel with the bear and to find prey elsewhere.

success_outcomes.text: Your wolves are smaller but they outnumber the bear, if only by a little, and it's a prize they're willing to fight for. With a prayer to StarPack they throw themselves into battle, and the bear, already half full of food and unwilling to lose blood over it, is driven off from the kill.
s_c shows their strength, leading the fight against the bear. By working together and keeping it distracted, the wolves harry and harass the bear until it gives up and runs.

The patrol launches into battle, but with so few wolves it's exhausting trying to keep the bear and its claw swipes on the defensive. In an act of daring bravery, s_c darts low to the ground, gets under the jaws, and sinks {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} teeth into the bear's throat. It's only one bite, but the young bear has had enough and flees.

fail_outcomes.text: Your patrol fails to drive away the bear, which keeps possession of the food. However there were no injuries.
The patrol launches into battle, but r_c is caught with a nasty bite, and the wolves give up on challenging for the food in favor of quickly helping r_c back to the medicine wolf den.

history_text.scar: m_c carries a scar from a bear fight.

fail_outcomes.text: s_c means well, but {PRONOUN/s_c/subject}{VERB/s_c/'re/'s} overconfident in {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} attack and the bear manages to brutally swipe {PRONOUN/s_c/object}. The patrol is forced to retreat, forming a defensive ring around the hurt s_c.

history_text.scar: m_c carries a scar from a bear fight.

intro_text: Your patrol catches the scent of a grizzly bear. Tracking it, they find the animal feeding on a pronghorn fawn carcass.
decline_text: Your patrol decides not to quarrel with the bear and to find prey elsewhere.

success_outcomes.text: Your wolves are smaller but heavily outnumber the bear, and it's a prize they're willing to fight for. With a prayer to StarPack they throw themselves into battle, and the bear, already half full and unwilling to lose blood over it, is driven off from the kill.

s_c shows their strength, leading the fight against the bear. By working together and keeping it distracted, the wolves harry and harass the bear until s_c lands a crucial blow, snapping a tendon in one of the bear's hind legs. The bear runs, but there's no way it'll live long with such a crippling injury.

The patrol launches into battle, keeping the bear on the defensive with teamwork. In an act of daring bravery, s_c darts low to the ground, gets under the jaws, and sinks {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} teeth into the bear's throat. Holding on grimly, s_c's daring move gives the rest of the patrol the opportunity needed to bring the bear down for good.

fail_outcomes.text: Your patrol fails to drive away the bear, which keeps possession of the food. However with so many wolves to protect each other, there were no injuries.
The patrol launches into battle, but r_c is caught with a nasty bite, and the wolves give up on challenging for the food in favor of quickly helping r_c back to the medicine wolf den.

history_text.scar: m_c carries a scar from a bear fight.

fail_outcomes.text: s_c means well, but {PRONOUN/s_c/subject}{VERB/s_c/'re/'s} overconfident in {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} attack and the bear manages to sink their teeth into {PRONOUN/s_c/object}. The patrol is forced to retreat, forming a defensive ring around the hurt s_c.

history_text.scar: m_c carries a scar from a bear fight.

intro_text: r_c catches the scent of a grizzly bear. Tracking it, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/find/finds} the animal feeding on a pronghorn fawn carcass. The bear looks rather large, even compared to other hibernation-ready bears.
decline_text: r_c decides not to quarrel with the bear and to find prey elsewhere.

success_outcomes.text: r_c may be smaller, alone, and half its weight, but the bear has a prize {PRONOUN/r_c/subject}{VERB/r_c/'re/'s} willing to fight for. With a prayer to StarPack, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/throw/throws} {PRONOUN/r_c/self} into battle. The bear, already stuffed full and unwilling to lose blood over it, leaves the kill with a grumble.

s_c uses every trick in their talented fighting skillset to attack the bear with no one to watch their flank, until the perfect opportunity opens up. They pounce onto the bear's back, digging in their claws and teeth. It's a wild ride through the plains until the bear bucks them off, but it wins them the fawn carcass.

In an act of daring bravery, s_c darts low to the ground, gets under the jaws, and sinks {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} teeth into the bear's throat. But then {PRONOUN/s_c/subject}{VERB/s_c/'re/'s} stuck, unwilling to let go and risk being bitten or maimed. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP}{VERB/s_c/'re/'s} dragged through the plains, over rocks and through bushes, until the bear finally collapses and the battered s_c goes back to proudly claim the fawn.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c fails to drive away the bear, which keeps possession of the food. However, there were no injuries.

Fiercely, r_c throws {PRONOUN/r_c/self} at the bear, determined to win the fawn prize. But the bear values it just as dearly, and manages to get a good grip on r_c, shaking {PRONOUN/r_c/object} to pieces and killing {PRONOUN/r_c/object}.

history_text.scar: m_c carries a scar from a solo bear fight.
history_text.reg_death: m_c fell in a solo battle with a bear.
history_text.lead_death: died in battle with a bear

fail_outcomes.text: r_c launches into battle, but is bitten and hit, and retreats to limp back home. The bear doesn't follow, happy enough to eat the fawn instead of the foolish wolf.

history_text.scar: m_c carries a scar from a solo bear fight.
history_text.reg_death: m_c fell in a solo battle with a bear.
history_text.lead_death: died in battle with a bear

fail_outcomes.text: s_c is overconfident in {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} attack, and the bear manages to sink their teeth into {PRONOUN/s_c/object}. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/s_c/retreat/retreats}, bleeding and in pain, and the bear settles back down to its meal.

history_text.scar: m_c carries a scar from a solo bear fight.
history_text.reg_death: m_c fell in a solo battle with a bear.
history_text.lead_death: died in battle with a fox

intro_text: Your patrol catches the scent of a feline - but what kind?
decline_text: Your patrol decides not to pursue the feline.

success_outcomes.text: The lynx smells like the prey she's been poaching to feed her litter. She's stolen from c_n for the last time, and the patrol drives her from their territory, snarling their anger and fury.
Your patrol drives away the lynx, and seeks out her den, but her leaf-fall cubs are near full-grown and scatter into the wilderness. Hopefully leaf-bare takes care of them.
s_c displays incredible skill, driving the mother lynx they track down out of the territory almost by themselves. It truly proves s_c's place as one of c_n's most talented and skillful fighters.

The patrol hunts down and overcomes the lynx they discover, driving her off thanks to a brilliant battle move by s_c at a critical moment. {PRONOUN/s_c/poss/CAP} bravery ensures the patrol's success, and the wolves arrive back at camp singing {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} praises to make sure the Pack knows it.

fail_outcomes.text: The mother lynx is vicious and determined, and the small patrol is beaten back. But these plains belong to c_n, and they haven't given up. They may have lost this battle, but c_n will win this war.

s_c is determined to win, but {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} confidence is misplaced. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject}{VERB/s_c/'re/'s} a good fighter, but not a great one, and the lynx manages to sink her teeth into {PRONOUN/s_c/object}. The patrol rallies around s_c, but they have to give up the fight.

history_text.scar: m_c carries a scar from a lynx fight.
history_text.reg_death: m_c fell in battle with a lynx.

fail_outcomes.text: Never threaten a mother's young - the lynx kills r_c in the skirmish.

history_text.scar: m_c carries a scar from a lynx fight.
history_text.reg_death: m_c fell in battle with a lynx.
history_text.lead_death: died in battle with a lynx

fail_outcomes.text: The mother lynx's snapping jaws leave r_c dripping blood onto the grass, forcing the patrol to back off.

history_text.scar: m_c carries a scar from a lynx fight.
history_text.reg_death: m_c fell in battle with a lynx.
history_text.lead_death: died in battle with a lynx

fail_outcomes.text: s_c is determined to win, but {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} confidence is misplaced. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject}{VERB/s_c/'re/'s} a good fighter, but not a great one, and the lynx manages to sink her teeth into {PRONOUN/s_c/object}. The patrol rallies around s_c, but they have to give up on the fight.

history_text.scar: m_c carries a scar from a lynx fight.
history_text.reg_death: m_c fell in battle with a lynx.
history_text.lead_death: died in battle with a lynx

intro_text: Your patrol catches the scent of a feline - but what kind?
decline_text: Your patrol decides not to pursue the feline.

success_outcomes.text: Led by p_l and with a heap of cooperation and teamwork, the patrol drives away the lynx, and seeks out her den. But her cubs are near full-grown with the bounty of leaf-fall, and scatter from the patrol into the wilderness. Hopefully leaf-bare takes care of them.

With so many wolves working together in tight coordination, they manage to accomplish the near-impossible, killing the mother lynx and ending the threat to the Pack that she poses. The patrol drives her near-full grown litter of lynx cubs out from the territory. Hopefully the coming leaf-bare will take care of them.
s_c displays incredible skill, driving the mother lynx they track down out of the territory almost by themselves. Now neither the lynx nor her cubs pose a threat to c_n.

The patrol hunts down and overcomes the lynx they discover, driving her off thanks to a brilliant battle move by s_c at a critical moment. {PRONOUN/s_c/poss/CAP} bravery ensures the patrol's success, and the wolves arrive back at camp singing {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} praises to make sure the Pack knows it.

fail_outcomes.text: The mother lynx is vicious and determined. Although they lose this battle, through teamwork the wolves manage to retreat without injury.
r_c is left wounded as the patrol and the mother lynx fight to a stalemate. Hopefully they've given the lynx mother a reason not to return to this part of the plains.

history_text.scar: m_c carries a scar from a lynx fight.

fail_outcomes.text: s_c is determined to win, but {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} confidence is misplaced. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject}{VERB/s_c/'re/'s} a good fighter, but not a great one, and the lynx manages to sink her teeth into {PRONOUN/s_c/object}. The patrol rallies around s_c, but they have to give up the fight.

history_text.scar: m_c carries a scar from a lynx fight.

intro_text: Your patrol catches the scent of a feline - but what kind?
decline_text: Your patrol decides not to pursue the feline.

success_outcomes.text: It takes r_c's every scrap of bravery and strength to drive away the cougar - her near grown litter, fat on the bounty of leaf-fall, is a challenge for another day. c_n will have to deal with the young cougars now roaming motherless in their woods, before they start to compete for prey in leaf-bare.

s_c displays incredible skill, driving the mother cougar and her brood out of c_n's plains all by themselves. Now neither the cougar nor her cubs pose a threat to the Pack. They swell with pride, feeling the confidence of knowing that they're truly one of the best fighters c_n has ever produced.

A brilliant battle move by s_c at a critical moment knocks the cougar they find off balance, and s_c manages to drive her out of c_n territory, though it takes every spark of strength in their pelt to do it alone.

fail_outcomes.text: Never threaten a mother's young - the cougar kills r_c in the skirmish, and carries off the body to feed her litter.

history_text.scar: m_c carries a scar from a solo fight with a cougar.
history_text.reg_death: m_c fell in a solo battle with a cougar.
history_text.lead_death: died in battle with a cougar

fail_outcomes.text: The mother cougar's furious swipes and snapping teeth leave r_c dripping blood onto the grass, and barely able to escape further injury.

history_text.scar: m_c carries a scar from a solo fight with a cougar.
history_text.reg_death: m_c fell in a solo battle with a cougar.
history_text.lead_death: died in battle with a cougar

fail_outcomes.text: s_c is determined to win, but the cougar is determined to live, and that makes all the difference. s_c ends up pinned in a defensible hiding spot, bleeding and terrified, until the cougar judges {PRONOUN/s_c/object} no longer a threat and continues on her way.

history_text.scar: m_c carries a scar from a solo fight with a cougar.
history_text.reg_death: m_c fell in a solo battle with a cougar.
history_text.lead_death: died in battle with a cougar

intro_text: Your patrol catches the scent of a feline - but what kind?
decline_text: Your patrol decides not to pursue the feline.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol charges the bobcat, and she runs, leaving the scent of milk in the air behind her. But they don't know where her cubs might've been hidden, and they'll be old enough to survive without her - this bodes ill for leaf-bare.

The patrol sneaks closer, until p_l realises that the bobcat is approaching her den. Her cubs, nearly full grown on prey stolen from c_n's territory, poke their heads out, and the wolves bark in outrage. They charge the den, killing two of the cubs before the bobcat runs with her third.

s_c holds the patrol back until they spot the bobcat's mate, approaching with poached prey in his jaws. Together, the wolves ambush the bobcats, bursting from cover with fangs snapping as a vicious fight starts. But warriors fight as a team, and the bobcats do not, and one flees, abandoning its mate and cubs to the fury of c_n.

fail_outcomes.text: The bobcat spots the patrol coming and scrambles, fleeing with insane speed.

As the patrol descends on the bobcat, her scream of surprise brings in her mate, changing the odds. The male bursts out from cover and sinks his teeth into r_c, and use the patrol switching to r_c's defence as their signal to flee.

history_text.scar: m_c was marked by a fight with a bobcat.

intro_text: r_c catches the scent of a feline - but what kind?
decline_text: Your patrol decides not to pursue the feline.

success_outcomes.text: Sneaking closer, r_c realises that the wind carries the scent of milk from the bobcat. It's a bobcat - and she has cubs. Eventually she leaves the area, and r_c begins the hunt, checking every burrow, every crevice, every hole until they stumble over the den. Two of the cubs flee into the grasslands, while the third falls to r_c's fangs.
This bobcat has a den, r_c realises, one perched just under a lone tree. Once the bobcat leaves, r_c digs around it to bury the den and its contents. No cat cubs will be raised within c_n's borders.

s_c scents the air, following the milk scent of the mother bobcat from afar. It means they can position themselves for the perfect ambush, leaping from cover to fasten their teeth in her throat. Her cubs will be old enough to survive without her, but this bobcat will never raise puppy killers again.

fail_outcomes.text: The bobcat spots r_c coming and scrambles, fleeing the area at insane speed.
As r_c descends on the bobcat, her scream of surprise brings in her mate, changing the odds. The male bursts out from cover and sinks his teeth into r_c, both bobcats using the chance to flee.

history_text.scar: m_c was marked by a fight with a bobcat.

intro_text: Your patrol catches the scent of a bobcat. Tracking it, they find a bobcat feeding on an elk calf carcass. The solo dog-sized predator definitely didn't kill this massive hunk of fresh-kill.
decline_text: Your patrol decides not to quarrel with the bobcat - bigger predators will be attracted here. Best to leave sooner rather than later.

success_outcomes.text: As the patrol approaches, the bobcat spots them and backs off from the carcass with a hiss. Your wolves can feed in peace for now, but larger predators will surely soon come to throw them off the kill. By cooperating together, the patrol is able to at least drag some of the intestines home to camp.

s_c sits and watches the bobcat as the patrol takes over the kill without a fight. It wanders the area, grabbing pieces of gristle and meat and caching them in little holes, giving s_c an idea. Together the Pack wolves gnaw off a leg, and take their bony prize back to camp for c_n.

While the rest of the patrol feeds on the kill, the bobcat gnawing on the head at the other end in uneasy truce, s_c keeps watch. It turns out to have been a wise move, as they spot a cougar's ears sticking up out of the grass. The kill's original owner is coming back, and the wolves vacate with speed.

fail_outcomes.text: The bobcat gives up on the kill with a defensive hiss, but a cougar screech in the distance sends both the weaker predator species running, the wolves puffed up and uncomfortable.

The bobcat gives up the kill, but s_c pursues the bobcat anyway... up until it turns and threatens them with a furious swipe. s_c calls the rest of the patrol for backup and no one is injured, but by the time they get back to the kill ravens are circling overhead. The patrol gives it up, knowing bigger predators will arrive soon.

intro_text: r_c catches the scent of a bobcat. Tracking it, they find a bobcat feeding on an elk calf carcass. The wolf-sized predator definitely didn't kill this massive hunk of fresh-kill.
decline_text: r_c decides not to quarrel with the bobcat - bigger predators will be attracted here. Best to leave sooner rather than later.

success_outcomes.text: r_c approaches the kill, fur puffed up. The bobcat hisses, but with a growl both animals agree to disagree, feeding from opposite ends of the calf without further trouble. r_c is able to find some decent scraps to carry back to camp, though with only them there they can't bring back as much meat as they'd like.

Watching the bobcat at the carcass, s_c notices it stripping meat from the calf and caching it in little holes, and starts to copy it. The bigger predators will return to claim the calf soon, but by the time they do s_c will have hidden away the choicest morsels to fetch later.
With great care, aware that the kill's original owner must be somewhere about, s_c snatches the first large scrap they find and leaves the bobcat to risk the wrath of the bigger predators.

fail_outcomes.text: A cougar screech in the distance sends both the weaker predator species running before r_c can muscle in on the feeding opportunity.

The bobcat gives up the kill, but s_c pursues the bobcat anyway... up until it turns and threatens them with a furious swipe. s_c dances out of the way, but hears the caw of ravens descending on the carcass, and knows it would be too dangerous to return.

r_c happily tucks into the massive calf - there's more than enough room for both them and the bobcat to feed. They hear a massive, outraged screech, and a blow from behind sends them to StarPack with a single hit. They never saw what did it.

history_text.scar: m_c carries a scar from fighting with a bobcat.
history_text.reg_death: While scavenging alone, m_c was killed by a predator they didn't see.

fail_outcomes.text: Puffed up, r_c approaches the bobcat. But there's only one of them, and the bobcat is much smaller. Instead of running or giving it, it hisses, and attacks. r_c gives just as good as they get, and both animals end up limping away from the kill.

history_text.scar: m_c carries a scar from fighting with a bobcat.
history_text.reg_death: While scavenging alone, m_c was killed by a predator they didn't see.

fail_outcomes.text: The bobcat gives up the kill, but s_c pursues the bobcat anyway... up until it turns and threatens them with a furious swipe, sinking them into s_c and giving them bigger problems than scavenging from a carcass.

history_text.scar: m_c carries a scar from fighting with a bobcat.
history_text.reg_death: While scavenging alone, m_c was killed by a predator they didn't see.

intro_text: p_l walks low to the ground, paws soft and light so as not to make a sound. Their jaws hang open to taste at the air, and a tingle of satisfaction shoots through them as they scent a rabbit.
decline_text: p_l watches it for a moment, then turns away and leaves. There's still time before leaf-bare, and if they wait just a bit they're sure to catch something even bigger.

success_outcomes.text: The wind shifts, but before the rabbit can react p_l acts fast and leaps, stopping it from fleeing with a quick nip to the back of the neck.

The rabbit, thankfully still bleary-eyed from sleep, doesn't notice p_l stalking up to them.. that is, until they've already struck and have it between their jaws. It's a little late to do anything about it at that point, though.

The rabbit blissfully snuffles around in the grass, completely unaware of the looming danger it's in. s_c stalks, as quiet as the wind, and doesn't even need to strike; they just walk right up behind it and take the kill.

fail_outcomes.text: The wind shifts, and the rabbit stiffens, scrambles away, and vanishes back into its burrow. Oh well.

intro_text: app1 has snuck out of camp alone, hoping they'll find a fat rabbit. Running through everything they've been taught in their head, they carefully scent the air and strain their ears, hoping for any hint of the burrowing critters.
decline_text: They're focusing so hard, they don't notice a Packmate is standing silently behind them, waiting for them to notice that they've been caught red-pawed. Oops!

success_outcomes.text: The wind blows a scent towards them, and app1 immediately drops into the grass. It's hard to locate between the swaying stalks of grass, and they're pretty sure at one point it's long gone, but in the end they find and catch it!

app1 hears a quiet shuffling nearby, and slides into the grass. Stalking forward, they find the source is a rabbit, foraging for food! They stalk carefully and catch it while it's distracted, heading home with their head held high.

fail_outcomes.text: Unfortunately, they don't end up finding anything, and they slink back to camp empty-pawed.

intro_text: p_l and app1 sit in the plains, near a network of rabbit burrows. This is one of a few such warrens, rotated around by mentors to teach apprentices their hunting skills. app1 scents the air as instructed, and points out a burrow; sure enough, there's a rabbit's nose poking out the entrance!
decline_text: p_l praises them and smiles, but reminds app1 that they aren't there to hunt, just to observe and discuss. There'll be plenty of time another day!

success_outcomes.text: p_l praises them and smiles, and app1 drops into the grass as the rabbit crawls out of the burrow. Though their paws are rather unpracticed, the basic knowledge is solid, and their hunt is a success!

p_l praises them and smiles, and app1 drops into the grass as the rabbit crawls out of the burrow. They're nervous, of course, but their technique is pretty-near flawless, and they catch the rabbit easily!

fail_outcomes.text: p_l praises them and smiles, and app1 drops into the grass as the rabbit crawls out of the burrow. Unfortunately, in their excitement, app1 rustles the grass a little too hard; the rabbit bounds off and vanishes into the burrow.

intro_text: The trio is gathered around an isolated burrow, discussing their plan in hushed tones. This burrow is an abandoned badger's sett, but currently is home to rabbits. The three entrances seem just big enough for the three apprentices to crawl inside, bringing the hunt right to the rabbits, who are hopefully unprepared.
decline_text: ... On second thought, maybe this is too risky. app1 and app2 exchange nervous glances, and app3 shuffles their paws before suggesting they go home instead, to which the others gladly agree. Better to stick to what they know.

success_outcomes.text: Slowly, carefully, the young wolves enter the burrow. It's dark and cramped, but they fit fine, and are able to follow their noses to the heart of the den. It's easy pickings at that point; the rabbits are unable to flee through escape tunnels, and some wriggle past, but when they emerge (covered in dirt and mud), it's with a good haul of rabbits to bring home!

Slowly, carefully, the young wolves enter the burrow. It's dark and cramped, but they fit fine, and are able to follow their noses to the heart of the den. It's easy pickings at that point; with the rabbits are unprepared, the apprentices kill them quickly and without any fuss. It takes two trips for them to bring it all home!

fail_outcomes.text: Slowly, carefully, the young wolves enter the burrow. It's dark and cramped, but they fit fine, and are able to follow their noses to the heart of the den. Unfortunately, the burrow is barren, not a single rabbit to be found, and the apprentices head home disappointed.

Slowly, carefully, the young wolves enter the burrow. It's dark and cramped, but they fit fine, and are able to follow their noses to the heart of the den. Unfortunately, the rabbits are ready and angry! They scream in rage, swiping at their muzzles and driving the apprentices back out of the burrow, where they turn tail and run home.

history_text.scar: m_c was scarred as an apprentice by a rabbit.

intro_text: p_l's patrol strolls leisurely through the plains, enjoying the cool air. One wolf raises their tail, signaling the others to be still; they've scented rabbits nearby.
decline_text: p_l quietly shakes their head and leads the patrol elsewhere. Better not to disturb the rabbits, who are too fast.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol makes short work of locating the rabbits, spreading out into a loose formation to encircle their prey. Slowly, they move in, the circle getting tighter and tighter, until they're finally seen. The rabbits scramble and scatter in different directions, but the circle cuts off their escape, and by the end of it they're fresh-kill.

First order of business is blocking their access to any nearby burrows, which r_c takes care of. After that, it's a matter of finding and catching the rabbits, which proves to be simple, especially with their access to safety denied. One really couldn't ask for a better hunt.

s_c murmurs instructions to their Packmates, who nod silently and move into position. One wolf feints at a rabbit, who raises the alarm and turns to run; another wolf blocks off the nearby burrow's entrance, forcing the rabbits to run towards s_c; and s_c lunges in for the kill. A flawless hunt, not a single rabbit left behind.

fail_outcomes.text: It only takes one rabbit spotting r_c to raise the alarm before they've all vanished into their burrows. Though the others made a few catches before they scattered, they didn't get nearly what they would have otherwise.

intro_text: r_c catches scent of a rabbit nearby. The grass here has gone to seed under the leaf-fall sun, and could easily fatten a few dozen rabbits for leaf-bare.
decline_text: Your patrol ignores the rabbit.

success_outcomes.text: r_c locates the rabbit and begins to stalk. The rabbit nibbles on a blade of grass, unaware of the hunting wolf. r_c tenses and leaps, snapping the rabbit's neck with their teeth.

r_c pinpoints the location of the prey and begins creeping forward. They're almost within pouncing distance when the rabbit suddenly bolts. With a quick turn, r_c leaps after the rabbit, barely snagging it before it reaches a burrow. They wag their tail as prey-blood hits their tongue.
s_c immediately drops into a practised crouch, shimmying flawlessly along the ground and taking the perfectly plump rabbit completely by surprise.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c narrowly misses the rabbit.

intro_text: app1 catches scent of a rabbit nearby. They lash their tail, wondering where in the tall grass the scent's owner could be.
decline_text: Your patrol ignores the rabbit.

success_outcomes.text: While checking in the tall grass for signs of their prey, the rabbit bursts from cover. It runs nearly under app1's paws, and they don't pounce so much as fall on it! Still, no one else was around to see their inelegant kill, and app1 feels very mature, bringing in prey to the fresh-kill pile by themselves.
app1 snatches the rabbit, an easy kill! They're really getting the hang of hunting!

fail_outcomes.text: Your patrol narrowly misses the rabbit.

intro_text: app1 catches scent of a rabbit nearby. p_l how more rabbits will be attracted to this area, drawn in by the grass that has gone to seed under the leaf-fall sun.
decline_text: Your patrol ignores the rabbit.

success_outcomes.text: app1 sets themselves up in ambush, pouncing on a rabbit with a squeak of surprise from both prey and apprentice. They look up, holding their fresh-kill, meeting p_l's eyes with a wag.
app1 stalks a rabbit to an easy kill! They're really getting the hang of hunting, p_l tells them, and as the pair head back home there's a happy bounce in app1's steps.

fail_outcomes.text: app1 narrowly misses the rabbit, their tail drooping sadly as it scurries off into the distance.

intro_text: The patrol heads out near dawn, padding into the mists around the grass that droops with the seed it carries. However, app1 seems more concerned with showing off to app2 than taking advantage of the leaf-fall hunting.
decline_text: The wolves are called back to camp - there's something the deputy needs to discuss with them.

success_outcomes.text: While p_l was right - app1 definitely cares more about how they look to app2 than hunting - it turns out fine. The patrol picks up a good haul of rabbits that were out foraging to fatten for leaf-bare, and p_l indulgently makes sure to tell app1 their reaction speed was very good in front of app2.

While the way app1 tries to burst out of a bush on a rabbit was categorically silly, the rabbits that were startled into the teeth of the rest of the hunting patrol make up for it. All the adults remember being young, dumb, and stupid with the desire to impress a pretty pelt. p_l takes app1 aside for a quiet word about toning it down a little, but the hunting trip goes well.

There is a time and a place for app1 to try their luck looking good in front of app2 - and that time is now! They trot back to camp at the front of the hunting patrol, carrying the rabbits they caught with slightly more than the right amount of pride.

fail_outcomes.text: app1 is so busy watching if app2 is watching them that they forget to watch their own paws - and falling into the cold river impressed nobody.

intro_text: r_c suggests the patrol hunts near the border, in areas that might soon be harder to access when the snows arrive.
decline_text: The wolves are called back to camp - there's something the deputy needs to discuss with them.

success_outcomes.text: As they arrive, the patrol startles two rabbits, and r_c manages to react quick enough to kill one with an inelegant snap. It's a good omen for the rest of the morning's work, which proves to be a productive and satisfying hunt.

Your wolves sneak into the hunting grounds, ears rotating as different spots catch their interest. r_c's suggestion proves to be a fruitful hunting ground, one that c_n hasn't used for a while and whose creatures (as predicted, nearly all rabbits) have lost their edge of wariness. It's a good hunt.
These are the times that it really pays to have a hunter of s_c's caliber on the patrol - they really go above and beyond, impressing everyone and leaving a trail of terror among the local rabbits.

fail_outcomes.text: Ah. r_c's suggested hunting grounds don't work out, not that anyone blames them for it.

intro_text: As the wind scatters the orange leaf-pelts of the lonely trees on the grasslands, pipistrelle bats arrive en masse to court, males belting out their high pitched songs of love.
decline_text: How very... squeaky.

success_outcomes.text: Distracted by love and the competition of performances to win it, the males make easy hunting for their delighted audience of c_n wolves.

p_l watches r_c leap with the thrill of the hunt, quite literally snatching victory from thin air. {PRONOUN/p_l/subject/CAP}'d feel sorry for the lover bats - but r_c is just showing who the best potential mates are. Showing the pipistrelles, of course. No one else.

fail_outcomes.text: How is anyone supposed to hunt with all this ringing in their ears?!
